      • getURI

        public java.net.URI getURI()
        Description copied from interface: IApplicationRegistration
        Get the URI representing the address that is used to send messages to the application associated with this registration. The URI can be used with MessageSenderRegistry.getSender() to get the implementation that can be used to send messages to the URI.
        Specified by:
        getURI in interface IApplicationRegistration
        Returns:

      • parseRegistration

        public static IApplicationRegistration parseRegistration(java.lang.String line)
                                                  throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                         java.net.UnknownHostException
        Parse a line of text into an application registrations object. The line is a comma-separated list of strings as follows: 
         namespace, instance id, ip, uri
        For example, 
         router, core1, 10.10.10.1, network://10.10.10.1:3022
 router, core2, 10.10.10.2, network://10.10.10.2:3022
 router, core3, 10.10.10.3, network://10.10.10.3:3022
 router, core4, 10.10.10.4, network://10.10.10.4:3022
        Parameters:
        line -
        Returns:
        null if line could not be parsed
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        java.net.UnknownHostException
